byline.contributor: Adam Nossiter and David D. Kirkpatrick contributed reporting from Tripoli, Libya.

abstract: Western security, construction and infrastructure companies that see profit-making opportunities receding in Iraq and Afghanistan have turned their sights on Libya now that Col Muammar el-Qaddafi has been toppled; entrepreneurs are abuzz about the business potential of a country with huge needs and the oil to pay for them.
snippet: Security, construction and infrastructure companies that see profit-making opportunities receding in Iraq and Afghanistan have set their sights on Libya.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

lead_paragraph: Security, construction and infrastructure companies that see profit-making opportunities receding in Iraq and Afghanistan have set their sights on Libya.

headline.main: Western Companies See Prospects for Business in Libya
headline.print_headline: West Sees Libya as Ripe at Last for Businesses
headline.seo: Western Companies See Libya as Ripe at Last for Business
